physical_appearance: This is a batik kain panjang. The colour of the textile is brown, and the design features stylised winged floral forms, clouds and floral bunches. These motifs are set against dense patterned background. The batik is framed by borders of floral designs. There is a signature at the bottom-right of the batik.
sgcool_label_text: The ochre background of this kain panjang is characterisitic of the Kudus style, and recalls the soga brown Central Javanese batiks.  Floating on this batik are curious looking winged floral forms, clouds and floral bunches, set against dense background patterning.  The entire design is framed by borders of floral designs.  This batik comes from the family collection of Oey Djien Nio (1929-1987), the last in three generations of documented batik-makers in Pekalongan.  In her earlier signatures, she used her husband’s name, Liem Siok Hien.  But from 1965 onwards, she used Jane Hendromartono, combining her husband’s new Indonesian family name, Hendromartono with Jane, as people addressed her by.  She developed a personal style distinct from her mother and grandmother, and experimented with a wide spectrum of colours and exotic combinations of birds, rock formations and mythical animals.  Jane Hendromartono’s clientele expanded beyond the elite in Indonesia to include Europe, America and Japan, especially in the 1980s.  This batik is signed “Batik Kesenian Liem Siok Hien Kudus”.
subject_terms_2: Batik Ethnic costume Peranakan (Asian people) Motifs Culture diffusion
